result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny L. Minto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kelsey addressed the court he was unable to reach his client.  Atty Poquette addressed the Court.  State moved to amend to co. ord. DC $859.50.  
Court:  grants motion to amend.  NC entered by Atty Kelsey.  Court:  amended to co. ord. DC forfeit $859.50 given 30 dtp.
Reserve Judge - Honorable Michael Lucci will be presiding on Sawyer County hearings on Tuesday, May 29, 2018.
RESERVE JUDGE KENNETH KUTZ WILL BE PRESIDING ON ALL OF THE SAWYER COUNTY CASES ON 05/29/2018.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on May 29, 2018 at 10:00 am.

DEFERRED JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION AGREEMENT

Defendant Danny L. Minto in court with attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights; parties stipulate to facts; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; court accepts plea and executes the Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreement.  For 3 years the defendant agrees to comply with the conditions set forth in the agreement.  After 3 years if the Defendant has complied with conditions set forth the State will move to amend the felony to an ordinance violation.  Restitution plus surcharges shall be made payable to the Clerk of Courts office for the victim (joint and several with 14CF76) in the amount of $296.00 within 60 days of today's date.  Keep Clerk advised of current address.  Plea questionnaire filed.
